articles.title: R spatial workshop
articles.description: A somewhat gentle introduction to working with spatial data in R.
articles.contents:
Slides and worksheets for a three day workshop providing an introduction to working with spatial data in R. Mostly, that means learning how to work with the sf and raster packages. The content and exercises are designed for 3 two-hour meetings.
All lessons are based on Lovelace, Nowosad, and Muenchow (2021) Geocomputation with R. Itâ€™s open-source and freely available here. This is an excellent resource, and something I find myself consulting quite often. Exercises are a mix of the exercises provided in that text and my own additions.
Outline:
Day One: Introduction
Installation and a brief overview of vector and raster data
Reading and writing spatial data
Projecting spatial data
Reading: Ch 2, 6, and 7

Day Two: Change, Subset, and Select Data
Attribute data operations
Spatial data operations
Reading: Ch 3 and 4

Day Three: Change Geometry and Plot
Geometry data operations
Making pretty maps
Reading: Ch 5 and 8
